How about to replace this `for` loop with:

this->joints.erase(

content.raw:
Both new functions are covered; `CreateJoint` has no branches, and `RemoveJoint` has 50% branch coverage:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/429/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_physics/Model_cc.html#1285

content.html:
appears to be an issue with shared pointers destruction. I am not sure how to fix this properly, but this helps

$ hg diff
diff -r 0301bf3f3438 gazebo/physics/World.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/World.cc   Fri Oct 09 16:35:56 2015 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/physics/World.cc   Mon Oct 12 22:52:36 2015 -0700
@@ -859,7 +859,7 @@
     this->dataPtr->physicsEngine.reset();
   }

-  this->dataPtr->models.clear();
+  // this->dataPtr->models.clear();
   this->dataPtr->prevStates[0].SetWorld(WorldPtr());
   this->dataPtr->prevStates[1].SetWorld(WorldPtr());

content.raw: `Model::CreateJoint()` calls `GetPhysicsEngine()->CreateJoint()`, that can throw an exception if the joint type is not one the types expected. For example, look at `ODEPhysics.cc::CreateJoint()`. So, I think we should add a `\throws` to the doxygen documentation of this method.
content.html: Model::CreateJoint() calls GetPhysicsEngine()->CreateJoint(), that can throw an exception if the joint type is not one the types expected. For example, look at ODEPhysics.cc::CreateJoint(). So, I think we should add a \throws to the doxygen documentation of this method.

content.raw:
taking a closer look at `PhysicsEngine::CreateJoint`, more specifically [ODEPhysics::CreateJoint](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/84edb8acc2f355a062dcda291576a5000b312c96/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc?at=issue_1077&fileviewer=file-view-default#ODEPhysics.cc-687), this call is much lower level than what I was looking for.
Going forward, we'll tutorialize the call through the new `Model::CreateJoint` proposed in this branch as the preferred API for model manipulation.
content.html: taking a closer look at PhysicsEngine::CreateJoint, more specifically ODEPhysics::CreateJoint, this call is much lower level than what I was looking for. Going forward, we'll tutorialize the call through the new Model::CreateJoint proposed in this branch as the preferred API for model manipulation.

content.raw: So this is a new API. Are we going to recommend this over calling `PhysicsEngine::CreateJoint`? I'd rather not have two API's, one of which works better than the other.
